intro: Siphoneugena kiaerskoviana, commonly known as the Greenland lichen, is a rare and specialized lichen species found primarily in the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a composite organism composed of a fungal partner and a green algal partner, forming a symbiotic relationship that allows it to thrive in extreme environmental conditions. The plant exhibits a crustose growth form, adhering tightly to surfaces such as rock and soil. It is characterized by its pale green to yellowish coloration and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a valuable indicator species for ecological health.
